benchmark_details.name: MMMT-IF (Multimodal Multi-Turn Instruction Following)
benchmark_details.overview: MMMT-IF is an evaluation benchmark for instruction following capabilities in multimodal, multi-turn dialogue contexts. It includes image-based Q&A tasks with global instructions across turns, designed to assess how well models retrieve and follow instructions throughout an extended conversation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the instruction following capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in the context of multimodal, multi-turn conversations.

data.source: Generated dataset through image-based dialogues with multiple instructions and turns.
data.annotation: Human annotations for reference answers and ratings on instruction following and accuracy.

methodology.calculation: PIF is calculated as the fraction of given instructions followed in responses using the original input context and model outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PIF scores indicate better adherence to instructions across multiple turns.
methodology.validation: Based on correlation with human evaluations and automated metrics.
